result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Tanell Gregory

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory in Court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in Court for Allen Tanell Gregory.  Attorney William T. Berens in Court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Deaf Interpreter: David Letkiewicz. Sworn as ASL/Hearing Interpreter: Jill Doering. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Clerk provided information to Interpreter Coordinator. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant previously entered a DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Final PreTrial, and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

ALL FUTURE HEARINGS MUST BE DONE IN-PERSON AND AT LEAST 30-45 MINUTES NEEDS TO BE BLOCKED. 
Clerk provided information to Interpreter Coordinator. 

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Final PreTrial needs to be rescheduled. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Allen Tanell Gregory.  Attorney William T. Berens in Court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Deaf Interpreter: Justin Vollmar. Sworn as ASL Interpreter: Amy Simonsen. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Court reviewed Defense Notice of Motion and Motion to Quash Bindover and to Dismiss the Information. Discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard regarding Defense Motion. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Quash Bindover and to Dismiss the Information. Scheduling Conference proceeded.
Defense Notice of Motion and Motion to Quash Bindover and to Dismiss the Information; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 18 pages) commencing 08-26-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Clerk made arrangements with Interpreter Coordinator for ASL Interpreter. 
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30pm will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Allen Tanell Gregory.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared in court on behalf of Attorney William T. Berens for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as ASL interpreter: Amy Simonsen and Sworn as Deaf interpreter: Tamara Fuerst, appeared by video.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received Discovery material from the State. Defense advised the Court, DNA Packet from Discovery had not been received. Defense requested Status hearing. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 9:30 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.  (Allen T. Gregory - #202007671, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial.  (Allen T. Gregory - #202007671, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
EXPIRES DECEMBER 7, 2022

Clerk made arrangements with Interpreter Coordinator for ASL Interpreter. 
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30pm will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Notice of Intent to File Motion for De Novo Review and Motion to Quash Bindover; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Sworn as American Sign Language interpreters, Amy Simonsen and Justin Volmar

Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Allen Tanell Gregory.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #14CF5252. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Worthington. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory in court, appear by video with attorney Brett Lee Copeland, appear by video.  Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as ASL interpreter: Patty Mccutch and Sworn as Deaf interpreter: David Letkiewicz, appear by video.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present due to being on vacation. Defense request to dismiss, court took request under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Dismiss from defendant (Allen T. Gregory Milwaukee County Jail - 949 N. 9th Street Milwaukee, WI. 53233)
Received and Filed

Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreters: Amy Simonsen & Justin Vollmar appear by video.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Lataryn W.; 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as American Sign Language interpreters: Vollmar, Justin / Simonsen, Amy

Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Allen Tanell Gregory in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen Tanell Gregory appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defense motioned to dismiss case due to insufficient probable cause. Court denied motion. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant. Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
